text: Governor Cuomo has extended school closures until May 15th. Information is provided here.
Thank you to our AWESOME OA faculty and staff for their outstanding work during this school closure! @OAhornets @OaElem #1

Many #thanks to our local @ChickfilA for donating cookies to our #communityfeeding sites this week! Today’s donation went to @les_smcps! They’re delivering to all sites this week so keep an eye out for locations! #schoolclosures #communitymatters – at Leonardtown Elementary School

Staff from @chs_smcps, @BBES_SMCPS @des_smcps and more are helping out at @mbms_smcps! Stop by and see them- today at all sites we have a special surprise for any kids who come! 11:30-12:30 #schoolclosures #feedingthefuture @NoKidHungryMD @MarylandHunger

@les_smcps is ready for you! @lpes_smcps @mbms_smcps @gkes_smcps are ready too! Serving meals for kids <18 years old 11:30-12:30 daily! #schoolclosures @MarylandHunger @NoKidHungryMD – at Leonardtown Elementary School

Thanks to the enormous generosity of the .@HartfordFdn, we’re able to purchase WiFi HotSpot Devices for our families w/o internet connection. We’re grateful to be able to provide this new essential during this period of school closure. #StaySafeStayHome #WindsorLocksPublicSchools

Interesting! @ChelsenVicari covered a few of these seminary closures. I do disagree that if liberal Baptist seminaries keep closing, liberal Baptists are likely to start taking up spots at Southern Baptist seminaries. They’re more likely to teach in schools of other traditions.

My years in the classroom were filled with trackers to understand the skills and content that student mastered. This data is critical to inform what to teach next and even more important during school closures. #dataliteracy

There is no partisanship. The governors and mayors issued all these stay-at-home orders, school closures and business restrictions so it will be up to them to lift them. Not sure what you think the president can do here? Please, explain.

This isn’t accurate. People were social distancing well before formal lockdown orders. Here in DC many of us started substantially changing our lives in early March. But even aside from that, formal closures in New York (eg schools) started on March 18, 24 days ago.

“Millions of Americans are faced with newfound stressors related to teleworking, school closures, unemployment, investment insecurity and health care uncertainty.” Protect your mental health, and let yourself rest. https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/finance/free-ways-to-protect-your-mental-health/ #TeamDCS #SchoolCounselorsConnect

It’s accurate. Despite Trump’s social distancing guidelines, @tatereeves said he will let MS know by Tuesday (the 14th) if school closures will be extended past the 17th. Seems everyone knows that it should last longer, but for some reason, Tate still has to think about it!!
Handsome smile from a student texting me this afternoon Thank you to parents who encourage teacher/student relationships to continue through school closure! #TrustyHuskies #CPSBest
Updated sites serving meals during school closure
This girlie had a lot of fun with the scavenger hunt her Science teacher @mrs_jenpayne prepared for the 6th graders. I had never seen her run so fast! @gentry_middle #CPSBest #schoolclosures

Since our extended closure began on 3/18, JC Schools has served breakfast & lunch to 5,808 students through our Mission Nutrition program. It is wonderful to see our students’ faces and know we are providing support for families during these uncertain times.#JCStrongerTogether

I do hope schools consider having class, even if it it just for a few days, just to close out the year. I think students and teachers would appreciate having a chance to see each other and to get closure—especially seniors. No academic work is needed.
seeing the various ways @nearpod is being used to support #distancelearning. However, this might be my new favorite example! #schoolclosures #remotelearning #covidEDU #nearpod

22 MILLION student joins in the past 54 days! ...+ 160 MILLION assessment responses! #nearpod SO thankful for ALL the Ts out there doing EVERYTHING possible to engage, support + educate your Ss during #schoolclosures!You the real MVPs! #remotelearning #distancelearning
“30 million children rely on school for food and with school closures.....so we’re going to read them books”

Hearing Di Blasio announce the closure of schools for the remainder of this academic year is crippling to those graduating. As a college and career counselor, I thrive on the excitement of my seniors.

Anyone holding up the NY government as a bastion of stability during this crisis can look no further than this exchange to see that our leadership is failing across the board. This is one hour after De Blasio announced school closures.

The school closures are excruciating for kids with special needs like autism who thrive on routine and need 1:1 social interaction. Zoom at least provides a moderate replica of that. Taking it away now just when these kids have finally adjusted ( a little) is nonsensical
I’m glad the art teacher from TikTok is doing well during the school closures :)

#StayingAtHome and #SocialDistancing are not easy for any of us but they can be extra hard for teenagers.Let’s be there for them, let’s listen to them and let’s help them cope with these uncertain times. #MentalHealthMatters #cyberbullying #EndViolence #schoolclosures #COVID19

NYC : I know there’s a lot to feel down about now: colleagues, long hours, cancelled Spring Break -but I don’t have to hold off on breaks, and I put on regular pants today-so that’s a@win, right? #wins #schoolclosures #remotelearning

I have no settled view and am not defending this, but NYC numbers are still quite bad and no one has any faith in schools ability to be nimble here. They could barely even try to clean the schools where known infections occurred, prior to the closure

Perhaps, it's the dash of hyperbole that your boss adds to his warnings that's the problem here and his terrible timing. Why do you need to communicate a major school closure on a holiday weekend? To pre-empt Cuomo so you can have some "ink" and airtime before Monday's presser?

#TeacherQuestions for @NYCMayor @DOEChancellor Cont. @News12BX How will schools that operate summer orientations for new or all teachers (primarily charters that require teachers to come in anywhere from 1-3 weeks early) be affected by building closures?

#TeacherQuestions for @NYCMayor @DOEChancellor Cont. @News12BX In regards to year to year teachers, (especially in charter schools all over the city), how are contracts going to be offered? How do teachers/schools interview for open jobs w/ closures/stay at homes in place?

@NYCMayor @NYGovCuomo You are the problem with NYC politics. You both want to be the “big fish” “Paul Revere” with important breaking updates. The last 2hrs, 2 different messages regarding school closure. Absurd! We’re in this together, remember?

In the last 3 years of teaching, I have been through a 10-day walkout for funding, lots of flooding and tornadoes, and now a closure of schools for distance learning due to a pandemic.

The primary method for limiting infections in a pandemic is school closures...it’s literally the first step in the pandemic response playbook and has been shown to reduce infections by almost 90% according to the models

Cannot be emphasized enough: Existing mental illness among adolescents may be exacerbated by the pandemic, and with school closures, they will not have the same access to key mental health services @NYSomh @HealthNYGov

I have the cover image on today’s edition of the Saratogian for a story about the impacts of school closures on students. Here’s the story behind that image: http://www.johnbulmerimages.com/2020/04/time-capsule-covid-19-saratogian.html

I’ll be the first to admit it, I watched this video made remotely by PVM High School Staff with tears in my eyes. Everyone @CentralSquareSD loves and misses our students!!! When the closure ends we need an official Redhawk Day of collective celebration

No, I’m the one that needs to thank you. I see you in the high school constantly sanitizing everything during this closure. You @Doloresbrown73 and all the custodians are our heroes!!! When this is over, I’m treating all of our custodians to a night of endless pizza and Karaoke!

@NYGovCuomo worked with govs in the tristate area to coordinate a shut down trying to ensure xstate contam I imagine slow school closure had many factors, the belief that kids are less likely to be infected vs their welfare ie. Childcare meals for some kids school is a safe haven

6-12 are using Teams. The majority had not been using it prior to our school closure so there was definitely a learning curve. However we were lucky to have 1 day that we were able to do a quick PD session and are providing online support to assist teachers on a day-to-day basis
“Our children will survive this and we all are going to come out stronger” @Molly_Spearman stated during live press conference on school closures. #Allinforkids #AloneTogether #SCStrong

This is a reminder that all school facilities are closed including ALL athletic facilities and parking lots This closure has been put in place by the Superintendent of Schools in order to comply with restrictions set forth by the Governor of Ky. The tennis court area is not ours.
